Review.Titre: Had a very bad experience with tech…
Review.Contenu: Had a very bad experience with tech support. Infrastructure failure that screwed my DNS. The resolution steps were "write us back when you see another domain down". It's a lower tier hosting, it's cheap and it works - most of the time anyways. I wouldn't use this host for important stuff.

Review.Titre: I was a big advocate of inmotion in…
Review.Contenu: I was a big advocate of inmotion in fact opened my first account over ten years ago.I had a few serious issues recently one of which is still not resolved. First issue is around email delivery; I was forced to move one of my clients onto Google Workspace due to spam attribution. The other is around the performance of a Wordpress site. I keep getting timed out when accessing the dashboard and it takes ages to get anything done.

You guys, in conjunction with others, have ruined email.  I regularly get rejections when sending email to people because all the spam detectors have black listed inMotion.  Some fail silently, and some suggest it's just a delay but after 3-4 days it fails.  I can no longer count of email.  My project for the next month or two is to move all my hosting somewhere else.

Review.Titre: We've been having server issues for…
Review.Contenu: We've been having server issues for over a week.  A very helpful support agent thought it was fixed yesterday after blocking an IP address from Russia. Today, when I called the support specialist (a different one), he was not helpful and essentially blew me off.  My issue is not resolved and this is becoming quite frustrating.

Review.Titre: InMotion Unable to Fix VPS Stability Issues at My Node
Review.Contenu: I have contacted support more than 10 times over a month about intermittent slowdowns affecting my server. On at least 2 occasions, their support has admitted that they are having stability issues at my particular VPS node but they keep assuring me that it is being taken care of. The server periodically taking 20 seconds to load a simple HTML page, and my CPU/RAM usage stays low while this happens. I have asked to be transferred to another VPS node and they appear to have no process in place to do urgent transfers, so I am waiting for some unknown period of time to hear back from their devops team. We have spent countless hours trying to diagnose this issue. This is been an extremely disappointing and costly experience.

When they email me back they say "it looks like it is working" though my dashboard shows clearly it is broken.While Cloudways is more expensive, it is worth it. Review.Titre: Unhappy with email deliverability for several years now.
Review.Contenu: I have been an InMotion customer for ~9 years. I've had to call tech support every few months for help with email issues for several years now. The email deliverability problems seem to go get worse, never better, to the where I cannot even count on any email being sent now, because I get 'bounce-backs' frequently. Though the customer service reps/techs are helpful, the issues I have with deliverability are not improving, instead worsening. It has been suggested to me twice now that I use a 3rd-party email provider such as Zoho or Google Workspace to ensure proper deliverability. Fine, but what am I paying InMotion Hosting $215/year for, which includes webhosting and email, when they suggest I use a 3rd-party email provider? Sure, their webhosting is fine, but why am I paying $215/year just to be told to use a a 3rd-party email provider when I contact tech support, only to have them adjust my 'A' records, then send me instructions on how to set up their email service followed by a request for a review? Seems like a slap in the face. InMotion used to be stellar for the for 5 years or so, but now they are far from it. Do better, InMotion.

Review.Titre: Dedicated servers probably aren't dedicated. It seems scammy.
Review.Contenu: Hosting is good but I am very suspicious of their claim that I'm on a dedicated server. I own a site that relies on people creating profiles and buying my courses. In that process, an authentication email is sent from the SMTP server in response to the registration to be confirmed by the user. If, through brute force, my site is spammed with bad emails and I hit a 5/5 per hour deferral limit, my server is shut down. I asked for my limit to be raised and they, the good people in tech support at InMotion, tell me that they have eliminated the limit however I keep seeing this message "Domain (my domain) has exceeded the max defers and failures per hour (5/5 (100%)) allowed. Message discarded." I just got this as I am writing this review. I've lost 100s of thousands of dollars and will be leaving today. I don't believe I am on a dedicated server and I believe that I have been scammed by InMotion hosting. Why else would they be unable or unwilling to raise or remove the deferral limits on the SMTP server?

They have changed the email from mine with you yet you always email me…over and over and over and over and over again. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE STOP!!!!!!!

I contacted support and they said they would install another firewall because they couldn't get the old one to boot. And from there the torture begins. After 5 minutes I start receiving messages about failure to start 9 services among which services pop, imap, hτtp, nginx, ftp, exim etc. I talk to support and after 25-30 minutes they told me that they will open a ticket request and it will take over the Advanced Product Support Team. 7 hours after no progress, we talk to support again and they assure us that the Advanced Product Support Team has taken care of it. 5 hours later still nothing. 3 tickets requests have been opened and they are not responding to update me on any of them. It is 09/23/2023 and still no progress. I host 12 business companies sites with corporate emails on my server and they all call me every half hour to inform them of any progress. Support nowhere.... And today evening they sent me an email to ask my opinion about their response. People are out of place and time. Because of them we lose customers and they ask for positive reviews. Gentlemen, you have to win the positive review but your support is not worth it. The worst is that I have paid for hosting for 3 years and I can't just leave and go to a more reliable company.

I needed a simple webserver that was a little more reliable than my local server. Account activation took several hours, even though it said it would take just a moment. I had to get in touch with support before it magically activated. The next day, the webservers had several HOURS of downtime. This was reported in both US and Europe, so it wasn't just me. I then had trouble editing with remote FTP. I tried a few different extensions in VS Code, but none worked well. Spent a long time setting up SSH just to figure out that there is some kind of caching on the webserver. So when I made a change to a file (PHP, CSS or whatever) it would take around 60 seconds before it was reflected in the browser. There is no way you can do any kind of development or debugging under these conditions. Support chat is sloooow, but they told me that caching can't be turned off with the "core" plan. This explains why FTP seemingly didn't work either. I just threw in the towel and requested a refund after two days with nothing but trouble and wasted time. InMotion Hosting was a horrible experience from start to finish.

Review.Titre: Inmotion domain email is too unreliable for a small business
Review.Contenu: I've had a domain with inmotion for several several years. This is why I am leaving. Their email reliability and support has become horrible. Two problems. First some of their email servers have expired certifications, leading outlook to refuse to connect unless I accept the expired certificate. This happens every few days now. More important is that once every few weeks an email I send to a customer is refused due to a blacklist IP address. I've talked to customer support about these issues. Their advice: wait an hour and try again since we cycle IP addresses every hour. Yesterday and today I had an email to a customer refused three times. I had to send it from a gmail account. I asked inmotion customer support if there was any way to get improved email and they said I should move my business email to another host, but keep my domain a web server at inmotion. This is unacceptable, so I'm forced to move. Other than the email issues I'm very happy with inmotion. I have to have reliable email communication with my customers and inmotion tells me that they will not or can not provide this service.

Got 2 accounts the first one is a dedicated server and the support is good the second one is a shared hosting and the support team can not setup and activate a Free SSL for 18 days in raw and the site is down and the emails are not working on any mobile device .

Review.Titre: Horrible speed, server setup and service
Review.Contenu: After some mishaps with old hosting providers I decided to give in motion a try. They didn't have any European servers, but I i figured that wouldn't be a problem. I'd had websites hosted in the US before, after all, and they worked just as wel as servers in Europe.Boy was I wrong. I don't know if inmotion messed up the migration (which I paid for), or horribly oversold the server I was on, but speeds were atrocious. I'm talking dialup speeds. The kind of speed that means it now takes a full minute to open a simple WordPress website.When I complained about this, inmotion blamed both the distance from the US to Europe and my ISP. Both are absolute nonsense, as I'm now with another hosting provider in North America, and I'm getting speeds literally sixty times faster.In the process of moving away from inmotion, they tried to prevent my exit every way the could. In a support conversation, they repeatedly pretended I hadn't told them how I wanted to download the website backup they offered to create for me, and when I repeatedly reminded them of the fact that that information was in the first message, they stopped replying.Had they not lied to me, and had they made the exit a bit more graceful, I might have been interested in the European servers location they plan to offer, but with service like this, inmotion is a hosting provider I'd avoid like the plague.

InMotion Support: 1 out of 10Takes them 24hour or more to reply and then its from a script, so after around 4-5 days you actually get the answer you should have had in the first place.Servers (Shared) 0 out of 10: Complete Slow Rubbish and I have been running my own servers in data centres for years, there servers are the poorest speed I have ever come across, ftp slow, www slow and everything just a snails paceEmails 0 out of 10: Contact black listed Ips and rather than them actually sorting out the spammers using their servers there answer after loads of complaints is - go find another email provider like gsuite or outlook, I mean really.IN REPLY TO THEIR RESPONSERe Support Response and Reading from a sheet..... It is Typical - I am coming to the end of a 2 year contract so this hasn't been going on for a little while! And why would I bother - your services are expensive for a lot of hassle. Your Servers are abysmally slow as can be seen on GT Metrix - your servers are not very well secured as can be seen on SSLLABS. your email system sucks as you constantly have banned IPs.....And I have moved most of my clients back to my own server which is far superior and a lot cheaper, My hosting (2 Yr Contract) ends in June and I wont be renewing or ever returning let alone recommending you! Oh and believe me I have complained about this in the last 2 years but as I paid up front (BIG MISTAKE) I was stuffed for a refund so have to stick it out, you offered solutions of switching to a VPS at yet more expense but when I asked technical details of the VPS your staff couldn't answer them..... By the way I am now running on a Hetzner VPS server and its A LOT quicker than yours, a lot more secures (A+ compared to your B) and A LOT cheaper !

"Hello,Thank you for contacting us regarding your issue. We can only take action if we are provided with a US court order or the site is specifically violating our Terms of Service.This matter would best be handled by making a formal complaint against the site owner to either the State Attorney General's Office or the Better Business Bureau or by seeking legal counsel if you are not able to receive a response by reaching out to the owner of the websiteOur office hours are from 9 AM to 9 PM, Monday through Friday, Eastern time. If you have additional questions or concerns you may respond to this message and we will address those matters. Your correspondence will be responded to in the order that it was received so please allow 2-3 business days to receive your response."

I had an incredibly disappointing experience with InMotion Inc hosting. I reached out to their sales chat to inquire about their web hosting plans, and the sales agent, Danny, claimed to have 13 years of experience but exhibited shockingly unprofessional behavior. Review.Titre: Ridiculously bad service and no apology
Review.Contenu: I have been with inMotion for 6 years and always kept my account fully updated. Initially I was on their VPS, which was satisfactory at the time. I've since upgraded to a dedicated server. I was never told that I would lose all customer support when I made this move. I'm not just talking about technical assistance support, I mean any kind of friendliness or professionality from customer support. As soon as I mention it's dedicated support literally tells me they don't want to help me with anything. I paid for 2 x 2TB SSD with my dedicated plan. I realised after a year that they didn't give me the second one. No apologies, in fact they almost didn't help me install the second 2TB, after much struggle that was added for me. No refund, discount or apology. A few months ago I changed from a monthly plan to a 6-monthly plan. Just before my this new plan was up for renewal I requested to change back to a monthly plan. I was told it was changed, but I kept checking and it hadn't been. 3 days after my term lapsed they suspended my server. Forget that I was waiting for them to fix my plan, who suspends a subscription after 3 days of non-pay for a loyal client of 6 years? My server was suspended for almost a day, again no apologies and they eventually said they would fix my subscription by 6 March and would keep my account from suspension until it's fixed. It was suspended once in that time but at least not for long (although it required some more support struggles). I fortunately followed up on 2 March (I had to continually follow-up as they didn't send me any updates on the situation). They then told me that my server will be suspended on 6 March, they can't change my plan back to monthly and they can't extend it more, they can't help to migrate to another package, they can't do anything and I will lose everything in 4 days time. Again, no apology, no assistance, no support, no customer service. I was grateful to move to a better unmanaged dedicated server with better hardware, better systems, and excellent service. These weren't my first problems with them but it will be the last. If they at least apologised or pretended to care but they have shown me the door and I gladly took it.

Review.Titre: Impossible to get hold of customer…
Review.Contenu: Impossible to get hold of customer service

My website hosting service, InMotion Hosting, has totally failed me with this website. I have been a customer for over 10 years. For most of those years, the few tech times I needed tech support, it was provided within 24 hours. Recently, one day suddenly almost 2 years of posts were missing on my website. This included posts, pages, categories, and even media files. I contacted tech support 4 TIMES IN 4 days before they even responded to my tech support questions. When they finally did respond, the answers only addressed some of the questions. It felt like it was a canned answer without any real thought or problem solving going into the response.I then responded with a request that they answer the questions of how this very selective deletion of posts, media files, pages and categories could have happened, and 5 DAYS LATER I finally received a response. IT TOOK 9 DAYS TOTAL TO GET THEIR OFFICIAL DIAGNOSIS ON THE PROBLEM. How is that acceptable for any business?Tech support claimed that there was an SQL database error and that they restored it to June 2020. However, that does not explain how media files after that date were affected.It is my belief (though I do not have evidence) that InMotion is joining other tech platforms and is engaging in censorship of content that does not fit the “official narrative”.  InMotion claims that they do not censor.Yet, the very selective nature of the deleted content suggests strongly that this was done by the hosting service, as a hacker would not go to such trouble to be so selective. Those who have followed my site know that there was never any violent, racist, graphic, or other inappropriate content here.  If I was depending on InMotion for income, this entire fiasco would have been a disaster. Gratefully, I do not depend on the website for income, but losing 2 years of work is so frustrating, and then having the lack of response, and then the weak tech support responses when I did get them is unacceptable.Personally, I cannot recommend that anyone use InMotion Hosting as a service.

I have been with Inmotion Hosting for nearly 15 years, and until now I would have given them a 5 star rating. HOwever, I am in the midst of having one of my VPS hosted e-commerce sites be down for almost 1 week without Inmotion Hosting dealing with the issue. By the way, the issue was caused by Inmotion Hosting migrating my site to a new VPS server, and making changes to allow for HTTP/2. Once the changes were made, permission on my site changed, and the website crashed. My developer cannot do anything until Inmotion Hosting changes the permissions, and that request has now been nearly 1 week and still not done. What has happened to the stellar tech support that Inmotion Hosting used to have? Something in the company has changed: bad tech support, highly increased fees, and seemingly no way to get things expedited efficiently. I am looking for a new host now, what a huge hassle.

He threw the F-bomb out for no reason other than because he felt like it. It was easily the worst experience I have ever had with InMotion, and I have been with them for YEARS. He was EXTREMELY unprofessional and unhelpful. If Zach (Zac, Zack) ever answers a call in the future, I will politely decline assistance and work through it on my own if I must.

It was time to create a staging site from a copy of the live site so we can make the changes without it affecting the main live site. We asked them to set up a staging. Subdomain and in the process just deleted all the things on the dev site and took down the main site for 48 hours. All the things we had done for blackfriday, LOST, the developer we hired to do the dev work will not recreate it again unless we pay him another 3 thousands dollars has its not his fault which make sense. So now we are at a Huge lost. We have asked for a refund on the 2 years plan we had but the clearly refused to do it. I simply cannot believe this people all this mess just before black Friday and we spend thousands to make it special for customers. Just avoid this company if you have an important site to host.

It’s been frustrating. To start with, I was given conflicting advice over the sequence in which to migrate the domain registration and the hosting. First I was told to move the hosting first. Then I was told to move the domain first.Then I found out that it wasn’t possible for your guys to move the email because of the way GoDaddy and Microsoft between them have locked it away from the outside. I verified this was true, but it was disappointing. So I figured out how to export the contents of my email, but I was still left with the problem of updating the name servers. It seems your guys can’t do that either. I understand that GoDaddy will do everything possible to keep hold of the account (except give me the service that I want), but it leaves me in a bad place.I just found a place on the GoDaddy site that describes moving the domain registration. It gives a sequence of steps:Domain transfer checklist:•	Make sure your administrative contact email is current. (It's where we send your transfer authorization code.)•	Verify that the new registrar will set up your DNS zone files. If you don't do this, your website and email could go down.•	Start the domain transfer at your new registrar. (We email you to ensure you requested the transfer.)•	Authorize the transfer with your new registrar. (Use the transfer authorization code we email you when you're done here.)•	We email you confirmation when your transfer completes, usually not more than 5-7 days.Of these things, the only one that makes sense to me is the first one. What I had hoped to do was pay your $200 fee to make all the rest happen, but so far the only answer I’ve gotten is that I have to do it all. And I don’t know how.Grrr.I want to give a shout-out to Donnie B, who sent me a “how to” description of what needs doing, but I’m too intimidated (so far) to try it. If you guys are unable to make magic happen on your end, I would be willing to pay the fee to have someone hold my hand through the process of doing what I have to do on this end, but I’m past the stage in life where I want to dig through arcane instruction manuals. The downside of screwing up my email (even more than GoDaddy has already screwed it up), is just too great. I love my website, but it is trivial compared to the email.Aren’t you glad you asked?Mary Ellena

Review.Titre: Inmotion Hosting has lost its way...
Review.Contenu: I've been a customer with Inmotion Hosting since about 2007. Their service used to be excellent; now, not so much. I find myself reaching out to tech support more frequently, especially in the last several months. The quality of support steadily decreased, but tonight was the first time my situation went unresolved. Although tech support has been helpful, I find getting things resolved takes a lot longer and frequently; it has been the same problem. Tonight, I just got offline with tech support, disappointed. Though the tech person was attentive, my situation is unresolved. He politely informed me they are not developers, and I will need to work it out. He shared an article where he found information on my problem. This request has been a recurring issue, and the last time, although I was online for an extended period, that rep could help resolve the issue. Now, I've wasted about 45 minutes and I still have the same problem.  I should have taken a clue a couple of days ago when I went into the AMP panel to purchase a new domain, and saw that my monthly hosting plan increased with no notification. They were just going to charge my card. I was told they rarely notify those on monthly plans and offered a discount to continue at my same cost. I decided not to purchase the domain with Inmotion and have begun to explore other hosting companies.Tonight's experience is confirmation that it's time to find another hosting company.Inmotion Hosting has lost its way and customer service seems to be an after-thought. I can no longer in good conscience recommend Inmotion Hosting.

Review.Titre: Well after almost 20 years with this…
Review.Contenu: Well after almost 20 years with this hosting company and nary a worry, I am looking for a new one. Their claim to fame was always 24/7 live support. In fact this is directly from their current website:"InMotion Hosting is a privately-owned technology company providing web hosting, cloud-based solutions and managed services to businesses and entrepreneurs across the globe. With over 170,000 customers, our mission is to bring tools, platforms and outstanding customer service within anyone’s reach to transform their online presence. Since 2001, we have built our foundation around 24/7/365 U.S.-based customer support, exceptional web hosting, and new product development leveraging open source technology."Why is this still on their website? This was their biggest draw. Their support staff were fantastic. For the past week, I have been trying to pay my bill. When I go to pay my bill, it says "contact us". Very funny. You can't. Chat is inoperable. When you try, you get an auto message from yes, a contractor, the dreaded Zen Desk.  Zen Desk confirmed In Motion no longer offers 24/7 365 day support. Wow! How professional! Thanks for telling us, your customers! Way to go! Now my business is totally offline, I can't get my client's emails and I can't even pay my bill!  Love the reaching out to tell us that now they don't offer the same level of service. Oops. Guess we forgot to tell you. So sorry. (You might be sorry per some complaints to be filed).Our livelihoods are on the web. Period.  You can't have a hosting company that is non-responsive because for many of us, time off line is time off business. My bet? They were bought by an equity trading firm and now we are stuck with America's new version of a "company". Invisible "owners". Fired staff replaced by call centers. Terrible to no REAL customer service. Minimal engagement as long as they have your credit card number. Sad. They used to be a great hosting service. I hope I am wrong but I bet I'm not. We need legislation in this country to define what a "company" is because the current definition pretty much constitutes a fraud on all of us.

Review.Titre: Think twice, no tech support on weekends
Review.Contenu: If your a webmaster, be aware that the 24/7/365 support is only questions and sales. Pray that you don’t actually need tech services during the weekend. their entire staff of server techs don’t work on weekends!!! Explain that to your client when their site is down and thiers no one to help!! Try migrating your website on the weekend and the Cpanel backup restore function is locked…oh that’s right no tech support on the weekend. I’m on my first week with them..,,and I’m already looking for a different provider.

Had a 3 year plan that ends soon, glad that it is ending soon. Customer service takes forever and while the agents are very helpful, the service is poor. Data restoration tickets sit for days. They had free back ups that dropped off. They dont update servers as often, and am not sure the hacks I had were not related to that. The agents are helpful, cannot stress that enough.

The reps were always pleasant when I reached out via the chat. Unfortunately, though, I did not have a stellar experience with In-Motion hosting overall. Several problems with my website shutting down, which led to me having to redo the entire site. I was not able to get into my Wordpress dashboard, and viewers saw an "error" as my site for about 1.5 years. Whenever I did go to a rep, there was confusion about how to help, and ultimately, there was no resolution each time. So we did have to switch providers.

Hosting is good. Tech support is good, as well. Email solution is average - spam filters are not working well. But it is free - so there is a trade-off. Pricing is misleading - you will get some reduced price in the beginning, hiding the fact that it is temporary, and then you will be charged more later. In my case more that a regular price stated on the website. Pricing is borderline with low level scam, not very painful financially, but just annoying.

Simply no support at all. I purchased a VPS plan and wanted to have a dedicated IP which is included in the plan. However, there was no documentation or tutorial on how to do it. Technical support team were incompetent, one said my IP is already dedicated which was not. Other gave incorrect information. After 4 days decided to cancel my account. and now waiting for refund. One star for their refund policy.

3x now their mail servers have gone down for an extended period of time just in the 8mths I've been with them. This last one has been going for over 24hrs so far with no idea on when it'll be up (another 24 - 48 is what the guesstimate was). Website was down for 16hrs and they got that up eventually. That is unacceptable service. When I asked if they had redundancy email servers during one of their support chats the chat was terminated on their end. That speaks volumes.

Review.Titre: InMotion hosted my site for 3 years
Review.Contenu: InMotion hosted my site for 3 years.  On the fourth year they increased their hosting fee by over 50%.  I called customer service and their attitude was like take it or leave it.  No attempt to save the customer. I downloaded my files, moved to Host Gator and changed my nameservers.And I left.

Review.Titre: Good hosting services but poor support
Review.Contenu: Prices are alright, services usually operate fine. My main gripe is the very poor customer support.I have been seeing this message for months and months:'We are currently experiencing higher than normal chat volume resulting in longer wait times.'It is not higher than normal if it's been like that for months - they don't provide enough support staff and it often takes 20 to 40 minutes just to get through to a support member on web chat. I moved to NameCheap and chat support is usually with you in under 60 seconds.

Review.Titre: Update your PHp for christs sake.
Their pricing is terrible and they…
Review.Contenu: Their pricing is terrible and they raise pricing on you for services you do not sign up for and with no notice. But worst of all the servers will go down in the worst times possibly and for long periods of time. For the money, use AWS or anyone else!

Review.Titre: Used to be great, now declining.
Review.Contenu: First - finding a reliable host that has good pricing, high uptimes and reasonable support is a challenge in this ever-changing industry.I moved away from A2 because support chat was often unavailable and I had to create tickets, which by nature take far more time.While InMotion had similar up-times, I noticed from the beginning that the server was VERY loaded, Load Averages were 45-70, where at A2  they were about half of that (my HostGator account rarely reaches 1).That translated into slow loading of the WordPress backends.Lately the down times have increased, we are at about 99.1% over the last weeks.I wrote a ticket about the down times two days ago, but haven't received any response. Go figure.Moving away now to another, smaller host.

They use to have better customer service, now things are not so good. I called for the advanced customer support because my website was down (hosted on our dedicated server that we pay a few thousand dollars per year). The support agent was hardly apologetic, as the website was down due to InMotion’s fault. They told me that they had given us a new machine 2 weeks ago and had told us that we don’t need to do any changes. After 2 weeks, which is today, our website and database is down, causing us to loose thousands of dollars. It was all due to that Inmotion failed to inform (via email or call) us to change our DNS records (we were told by Inmotion that the IP wouldn’t change and we don’t have to update any records). The support agent was very rude. When I asked to speak to his manager, he put me on hold and asked me to wait for 2-3 minutes. I waited for 10 minutes and had to hang up without ever being answered by a manager. Didn’t get a call from them afterward either! If things remain this way, I might use another company — horrible!

Review.Titre: I have been using Inmotion VPS hosting…
Review.Contenu: I have been using Inmotion VPS hosting for more than three years now. At first the impression was good.Recently I have lost my databases, everything, my whole livelihood is gone. Support wasn't able to help me and I got no explanation about the causes. My databases, my websites, my content is all gone suddenly.An external hosting professional suggested that it must have been their fault, I will probably never know. Without getting into technical details, I now have no access to over 25 websites I had that ranked and had traffic. InmotionHosting did not even offer me another server as the current one is clearly compromised (wordpress installs with their toolkit don't work). Very negative experience and I would advise anyone to stay far far away from Inmotion, they are not worth it. It is not about the $1,000 I paid yearly.Partially it is my fault as I had no active backups but on the other hand, when I signed up they did not have backup as an additional service and now they do. A support staff told me it was 6 months ago they introduced that. Service went down noticeably in the past years. The reason I gave them 2 stars instead of the 1 that they deserve is because the support staff responds fast when you are dealing with simple issues.

I purchased their lowest cost hosting and  I installed a new, single page Wordpress website. From day one, my website was experiencing very slow  load times and it was not passing the Google PageSpeed Insights, giving the website a poor grade there for server response. It had on average a reading of over 3 seconds for server response and sometimes much bigger, a normal value should be of less than 1 sec. This is the time it takes for the server to respond to the initial page request and deliver the initial html file.I contacted support and they said there was nothing wrong with the server and the speed was fine on some other test tools they provided.I switched to a similar plan at Bluehost.com, and moved my website there. I did the Google speed test again, and it was perfect. It passed the test with a high score of 97 out of 100. So, clearly, there is an issue with Inmotion hosting. The new installation at Bluehost was 100% identical to the one at InMotion Hosting, but the server response time at Bluehost was much faster.I cancelled at Inmotion Hosting and got a full refund. Their customer support is ok, but they were not able to help solve the server response time problem. So i don't recommend them. I recommend Bluehost. The price is the same, and your website will load much faster, which is important if you want good Google search rankings.

I've been a customer of InMotion for over 5 years, and in that time have had a relatively good experience. However, within the last 6 months or so, I've noticed some serious deterioration across the board. It started with spontaneous drop-outs in my hosting; never anything more than 5 minutes, but still, if they're doing SCHEDULED maintenance, they could at least send out automated emails to let customers know they can expect an outage between the hours of __ and __ or something - just a courteous 'heads up' would be better than nothing.While that is permissible, the customer service experience isn't. In the past, I've never had to wait more than a minute or 2 (if at all) to be connected to a knowledgeable rep who could handle my issue quickly and courteously. In the last 6 months, I've experienced quite the opposite: interminably long queues for a rep (they are always 'experiencing higher than normal support requests' now), and when the rep does come online (which could be after anywhere from 15 to 45+ minute waits), they have been rushed, rude, and somewhat inept at providing adequate answers.The only reason they get 2 stars is because of the great service in the past. I will be migrating all my hosted domains to Siteground (who has AMAZING customer service) and recommending clients do the same as subscriptions expire this year.

Support has no skills and doesn't want doing everything.1 case: after registration I placed my site to inmotionhosting's host. Time to load pages 5-10 sec! But I have very simple site! I asked support and received answer - ask developer - our system works without problems. I written many mails to support and last mail from support said: We made all - you must buy VPS. Cool! After I sent angry mail and support moved my site from this host to new and voila - time to load less 1 sec! After moving I had problems with mails etc., because they only moving, didn't make changes in system, but this is little things compared with big time to load.2 case: I moved site from different hosting provider. At different hosting provider site worked properly. But, at inmotionhosting I have problems with sending mails from contact form. Problem with smtp auth, at inmotionhosting it doesn't work correct. Again I had many mails from support about contact developer; my mail boxes wrong; not correct, because they system don't determine names of my mail boxes, etc. But support agree that smtp auth problem at hosting end. Nice answer from support: you must use forwarder with same real mailbox only (but at  cPanel docs written - it is not necessarily, i.e. support from inmotionhosting does not read docs). Final answer - we made all - you must buy VPS!

Review.Titre: VPS NGINX Issues and Tech Support Failures
Review.Contenu: I started with InMotion because the reviews I read at the time from major tech blogs gave inMotion good ratings. My needs were a reliable VPS to host multiple websites. The first month or two was good and support promptly responded to my support requests until a problem with PHP-FPM. The PHP-FPM service would stop responding affecting ALL sites on the VPS. None of the sites on the VPS were able to load php web pages. After 5-15 minutes the server would recover and the sites would start loading php web pages again. This process would repeat every 2-3 hours.Tech support could not solve the issue and blamed me. I came up with my own temporary solutions by using a cron job to restart the PHP-FPM service every 15 minutes.Tech support applied a NGINX configuration to my VPS but it was not setup correctly because every site on the VPS would not load. Tech support could not resolve that issue so I had them roll back the config changes.Finally, about a week ago I was again faced with all of the sites on my VPS not loading. I contacted support and they claimed that the firewall was changed. They couldn't tell me when or how the firewall was changed. They attempted to blame me and accused me of changing the firewall. Eventually, they claimed to have reinstalled the firewall... and my sites were loading again. They did not open port 22 for ssh so I have to open another support ticket to get port 22 opened...Technical support has been a complete failure and disappointment. After multiple arguments with support they finally agreed to refund the prepaid service I haven't used. I am in the process of migrating to AWS now.

It took a while for you to find and fix the issue, normally the issue is resolved in an hour or two (or less). This time it took more than 24 hours and I was never told what the issue was that caused my site to go down.

Review.Titre: Your staff has been very helpful
Review.Contenu: Your staff has been very helpful. Without their help, I wouldn't have been able to get anything set up. There were complications with setting up basic email. Tech support had to ask additional support teams what the issue was. Eventually, they fixed it. I had to wait many days to get my clients email set up, which prevented us from setting up additional 3rd party accounts. In short, the tools provided to customers to manage their own account don't work without support intervention.  I would give additional stars if support wasn't needed at all.

You have an amazing support when everything is fine. But when you have a fallout, which happened in 1 year 7 times the servers are not reachable, no explanation, no respond to messages of your client, nothing at all. This is not customer service at all, you need to improve. And total fallout over a couple of hours in nower days is not acceptable to stay silent.

Review.Titre: InMotion is loosing the motion of keeping it up with other hosting providers
Review.Contenu: InMotion is loosing the motion of keeping up with the changing tech stack. Disk speeds are getting poor, bad load times but prices are increasing. Storage space decreased, creating cPanel accounts qouta decreased to just 25 from unlimited. Servers gets retired without keeping care of configuration before migrating to new Servers. In all its loosing it's charm and I honestly feel stuck just because of whmcs license that I got with you. Moreover, poor support on whmcs. Couple of times I have been told to speak to whmcs team when it was just issue of restoring backup of whmcs because it failed to upgrade to new version.

Pro: I'm a retired IT manager, so when I call in to have work done to my virtual private server I connect with someone who can speak the language and run commands instead of someone reading a prompt off of a screen. Hands-down the best techs.Con: I've been with InMotion Hosting for a very long time. My cost for my virtual private server has almost doubled. Once it hits double my initial price I will be looking elsewhere.

Interacted with web site only.  I was concerned about price increases, but I didn't have time to chat/discuss.I was of the first InMotion customers.When required, InMotion customer service is excellent.I recommend InMotion, but please do your research.

Review.Titre: I just purchased your hosting service…
Review.Contenu: I just purchased your hosting service about a week ago. I did it myself online and it was easy, went just fine.  I haven't experienced your customer service so 3 stars is best I can do with nothing to evaluate so far.You are asking for reviews way too soon. Be patient and check with me in 3 months and I will update this review. Hopefully everything goes smoothly and I won't need to contact customer service isn't that the goal?

Review.Titre: I always relied on speaking to a rep…
Review.Contenu: I always relied on speaking to a rep and the availability being 24/7.  This has now changed to only between certain hours and only during the weekdays.  Very difficult to get across what the problem is via an email.  Not a fan.

Review.Titre: You dropped the ball on two aspects
Review.Contenu: You were pretty competent at helping me transition my websites from webhostinghub but there were two problems.  First, the primary domain and the email address I offered were for caleb-ltd.com but you made it economiccures.com and now it is nearly impossible to change.  The most annoying problem though is a problem I have had to call in four times and it is still not resolved!  Every day, I get two emails that basically say:Automatic SSL Certificate creation failed!.Hello, for these domains name listed below the Automatic SSL certificate could not be created.Domain name	SAN5f534ab7d710631586.temporary.link	mail,webmail,ftp,cpanelThis message was automatically generated by CWP

Overall pretty decent Customer Service, but a few technical issues that I have had seems superfluous. Some of the limitations are odd and outdated, but all in all, even though I have been with you guys for about nine years, it just doesn’t feel like you are staying competitive at all. I am able to run some sites and Scripps on my other shared hosting with no problems that seem to have odd technical issues that always seem to require me to upgrade to the next hosting type, for roughly 1/3 or less of the costs.

Review.Titre: Great plans unless you need reliable email
Review.Contenu: The really good parts:  InMotionHosting has some great plans at mostly reasonable rates.  And I found Tech service to be very good.  In the years I've been with InMotionHosting, my websites were almost never down.The really not-so good part:  Their email is terrible at best.  Email is hosted on the same server as your website. This means sharing reputations with other users on the server.  Multiple times a week (if not a day) I would have email blocked because other users were using their email for spamming.  My clients were often annoyed waiting for time sensitive material from me.  I eventually had to pay for a different email provider.So if your business requires time sensitive email capability (delivered within a day), the price of the product provided is way to high.  I took this up with InMotionHosting, and their response was that I should pay for a third party email service.

Review.Titre: We ordered a VPS site upgrade for our…
Review.Contenu: We ordered a VPS site upgrade for our client's site that was already hosted on InMotionHosting. The existing site was taken down several days before the new one was ready on the new server. Our client's site is used for training and we had an unhappy client.

Review.Titre: I got my bill this year and it was way…
Review.Contenu: I got my bill this year and it was way higher than I'm used to.... Checked and saw that I was signed up for a backup subscription I didn't sign up for and then noticed that the launch plan which used to be the least expensive was replaced by a different least expensive option.... I immediately cancelled the subscription and changed to the new least expensive plan, that had the same features as the plan I originally signed up for.... Plan says pro rated but I never was offered a refund for price difference..... Not very happy....Update: 9/5/2023Customer service did reach out to fix the situation.... Was refunded for the subscription.... And offered refund or extension on the plan difference.... Upgraded from 1 to 3 stars ...

Documentation is sparse and often discusses features that you do not provide. No catch-all email addresses is puzzling and might drive me to find a different provider. The jury is still out...Softaculous offerings are disappointing. No Nextcloud, for example.

Review.Titre: From the first call I tried to tell…
Review.Contenu: From the first call I tried to tell them the (Pop3) may the issue. Over a week daily talking to over 7 reps and no one listened until Jacob did yesterday and fixed the email issue.

Liked that there was a short (for experts) and long (step by step details) version of instructions. However, some of the language was confusing and I had a few questions that were specific to my situation, but was unable to find support. Have you done away with live support?
What you are doing well is being available, getting back to me fairly quickly, but you are not good at problem solving and being helpful.

Review.Titre: The quality does not align with the…
Review.Contenu: The quality does not align with the positive reviews.Their support team operates from the United States and, as stated on their website, the overall experience is commendable when compared to the support offered by Bluehost and Hostgator. However, we encountered an issue with email delivery and reached out to their support for assistance. Initially, they promptly acknowledged the problem, attributing it to an email delivery issue with the Outlook client. They assured us that the issue had been resolved. Regrettably, after a few days, the problem resurfaced. Upon contacting their support once again, we were informed that we had two options: either endure prolonged delays in email delivery, occasionally lasting up to 24 hours, or procure external email hosting services such as Microsoft 365 or Google Workspace. This response was profoundly disappointing, given that we had invested in their highest tier of hosting.

Review.Titre: Support is great but there new product…
Review.Contenu: Support is great but there new product "Platformi" is really buggy. Websites are slow even without traffic and database connections all over the place.Hope they can sort things out because the guys seems nice and did try to help out..

Review.Titre: We were charged $245 on 10.2.23 and now…
Review.Contenu: We were charged $245 on 10.2.23 and now we are being asked for another $72, this is disturbing!Why wasn't we asked to pay $317 to begin with!We don't like this 'nickel and dime' approach!We like our card to be tapped once for everything!Ralph

For new customers they give amazingly great prices but for those of us who have been with them long term the discounts are non-existent. Service is good. They used to have real live phone help but that has been gone. Their uptime is good and control panels decent. On a value scale they are just ok. If you can get on one of their best deals then it’s worth it otherwise consider a better long term solution.

Company has always resolved issues either administrative or technical.  Never had any issues in the past, but this incident the tech/sales assist simply passed along a bunch of links for me to read to resolve the issue rather than take the time to actually offer a solution.  Frustrating in this case, but not typical of how InMotion operates.
The setup process for wordpress is kind of confusing. There's not much in terms of wordpress template support either.
Sites have been experiencing downtime and going offline for periods to time repeatedly and Wordpress load load time has been slow.

Review.Titre: Good up time, bad experience with Cpanel
Review.Contenu: The company boasts incredible reliability but I've had a lot of trouble accessing the c-panel. As far as I can tell everything else is working fine?

Review.Titre: It was better in the past..
Review.Contenu: It was better in the past... need to improve some features respect the market and other hosting providers

They used to be good; I have been a customer for over 5 years and issues were previously resolved in a satisfactory approach. However, this time, I am seeing daily outages (caused by other sites on the same server) and all I get is meaningless and inane platitudes and no action in fully resolving the issue. Therefore, I no longer recommend them. They seem only too happy to take your money, but then fail to supply a reliable service. In the past they used to guarantee a 99.9% uptime for all service levels offered, and lo and behold they no longer offer this (I wonder why; because they are failing to meet the level of availability they used to guarantee). The 99.9% uptime guarantee is now only available on their Pro offerings. I will not be renewing my contract with them as I get better uptime when running my own physical severs on my own internet connections!UPDATE: They have now moved my site to a new server... and lo and behold, no more outages! I still won't be renewing my contract when it expires, as the level of support is not as good as it used to be.

Review.Titre: I had to call multiple times over the…
Review.Contenu: I had to call multiple times over the course of many days to finally get my question resolved

I have to assume that this was a request for help that was months old and had been fixed.  The reply I just received was that the problem still exists.  There is some real confusion here.  Very uncommon from the usual good service from InMotion.   ????
Ok Service, price hike after promotional period kind of steep
Generally ok. Queues in tech support getting longer. Service hours shorter. Quality of techie, weaker

Review.Titre: I have several problems trying to log…
Review.Contenu: I have several problems trying to log into Wordpress recently, I am not satisfied with your services.

Review.Titre: I didn’t want to be charged $209+ for…
Review.Contenu: I didn’t want to be charged $209+ for the hosting plan. But they are responsive!
Very good, customer service. But Server is very slow.

Review.Titre: I've been with InMotion Hosting since 2015
Review.Contenu: I've been with InMotion Hosting since 2015. I started out with the Shared Hosting Pro. Things were fine up until I started an e-commerce store with Shared Hosting Pro. The minute I switched all of the sudden the server was SLOOOOOOOOW as molasses. Due to the fact that I never had an issue in the past with them, I decided, well....maybe it's time to bump up to VPS. I got a VPS 4GB VPS server. After I got the VPS server, the website was much faster with an extremely noticeable difference. Which I was happy about. The only issue I have, is they sign you up for $19.99 per month when you pay for a year in advance and the next year you bump up to $59.99 per month. The transfer appeared to be seamless, up until one of my WordPress websites for my creative agency wasn't fully working. There is a 500 internal server error for the portfolio pages only. I tried to get support and they said it was a portfolio plugin that wasn't active, however that wasn't the issue, because it was a plugin from an old theme. I then paid for Softaculous, which if you know you're way around cPanel, then you know what that is and how handy it comes in for many things. When that was installed I had to go back again after they installed it to have them add all the software, features and scripts.When I wanted to use one of the two dedicated IP's they promised upon signing up for VPS, I asked for a dedicated IP and the representative asked me why? I have never been asked that before when using a dedicated IP and that's kind of a question that is self-explanatory by itself if you know anything about websites, design and development. The sites I run, I want running on a dedicated IP because I don't want to risk any reputation issues if someone on a shared IP isn't following rules that will affect sites in many different ways if you're not careful. The reason I bring that up is they forgot to add that when they created the account. Then there were all kinds of DNS issues that were popping up when I got the new IP address. It was bringing up a site that was installed on a different domain. I burned 1.5 days dealing with that. It was kind of ridiculous how long it took to deal with that. I had changed IP's on Cloudflare to match the new IP address. What wound up happening is DNS records weren't synched by the rep that I was working with to help the the dedicated IP and to match records so the DNS worked as it should.All in all, I would say if you have VPS, you should call in. The reps don't cover everything when you make requests via chat or try to get help via chat. InMotion also MISSED A LOT on the server transfer. I was kind of disappointed. I almost switched over to Dotblock even though they are more expensive. I've worked with them before and their customer service and tech support are stellar. If you're listening InMotion Hosting, you should be consider being more fair in the end with pricing. $19.99 for the first year and boosting it up to $59.99 is a bit much. I'd also say you should definitely work with your employees to make sure bases are covered on tech issues. That would relieve other reps from having to deal with follow ups from previous requests that haven't been fully resolved.

I’ve been with InmotionHosting for 5 years, and have 12 dedicated CC2000 servers with them (their biggest dedicated server package). So I can speak as a dedicated hosting customer, but not as a shared hosting customer. Since I’ve communicated with their dedicated tech support over 100+ times  over the last 5 years, I’ve gotten to know half of them by name, and I have a really good pulse on what’s going on support wise. Initially (five years ago) this company was really excellent. The servers were setup quickly, tech support was fast, reliable, and proficient. It was a small team as the calls always got answered by the same people in the tech support team. Managed hosting had an even higher, dedicated, and quality team. Most importantly however, the System Administration team (the team that’s actually at the server location, maintaining the servers) has always responded Extremely Fast. Any issues with the server hardware or anything else that made the server unreachable by the tech support team was handled very well. When something goes truly wrong - that’s the only guys that can bring your server back to life. Unfortunately, over the years, as I’ve watched the company dramatically grow in size, there has has been a steady decline in tech support. Support started to take longer to reach, and then all the familiar voices started to go away. They’ve either moved to other pastures or the team has started to expand in size, or both. The team slowly got replaced by newer, less experienced team members. Tech support wait times took an hour sometimes, so I had to resort to chat only, which sometimes would have 14 people in que anyway. Inmotion did respond to this increase in demand and recently wait times have been restored to less than a few minutes, which is great. As of right now, July 2022, tech support is back to very good. Wait times are minimal, and even though the team is much less experienced, they do care and try to get the job done for you. My main concern, and really the main reason we will be moving our servers elsewhere is because the System Administration team (the team maintaining your physical server) is clearly a Major issue at Inmotion. We have recently had 2 of our servers go down due to separate hardware failures. After calling support and opening tickets for the System Admin team to maintain the servers, it’s been 24 hours and the tickets haven’t even been opened by the team yet. This used to (and should) take less than an hour. Repeated calls don’t help. Escalating the issue to a manager or a supervisor is impossible. It doesn’t matter if you have a CC2000 or your server has been down for days, or 100k visitors are being lost hourly, or if you’ve been a customer for a long time. It’s important to note It’s not really the tech supports fault, they are still excellent.Ultimately, most hosting companies are the same when everything is working fine. What you’re paying for is for the support when something goes wrong. At this point, it seems that Inmotion is unable to keep up with the growth demand they have, and we can’t afford to wait for them to address these issues. So while it’s been a good ride - we’ll be moving somewhere else. Thanks Inmotion!

I found the customer service be rude and they tried to upsell me to a more expensive package. The hosting itself was ok, but they didn’t keep current on PHP versions and the software they provided for automatic installs such as Wordpress and Drupal always had notifications that they needed a newer version of PHP.The hosting is expensive even for the personal packages. I would not recommend Inmotion Hosting to anyone.

Review.Titre: I like the service but responsiveness has dropped.
Review.Contenu: I like the service, but customer service responsiveness has dropped precipitously.  In the past, I would get a response within a few hours.  Recently, it took 10 days to get a response and then another week to resolve my issue.

Review.Titre: I had two script based conversations…
Review.Contenu: I had two script based conversations with their help desk. On both occasions their response was excellent. However I thought these conversations were confidential but the scripts were given to the person I was checking on.

I've had InMotion hosting for almost three years and it's likely we won't re-up as the price has tripled (actually a bit more than that).That being said, everything has worked very well and the support has been outstanding. I definitely would recommend with a caveat about the renewals, but that's true of most shared hosting plans.

Excellent hosting Company because of the technical support team can typically fix most issues via call or chat.  Most of the technical guys know what they are doing.  I have multiple accounts with InMotion Hosting and have used them for well over 5+ years.

Review.Titre: The support is and was amazing
Review.Contenu: The support is and was amazing. However, the NEED for support is not great. Too many things that should be either push-button or automatic needed a support chat to accomplish.

Your staff is wonderful and knowledgeable. They know their stuff! I do wish there were incentives for customers who have stuck with your services over the years. Perhaps something like a discount reward for each year of customer dedication?

Review.Titre: Years of hosting and not looking to move
Review.Contenu: Our hosting requirements have changed very little over the past 10-15 years.  There have been occasional issues, like mailing lists, but nothing unusual that was not able to be resolved.  Technical support is good and if you buy premium support, you will get a tech guru who can handle your problem before you can explain it!  We are satisfied that we get the best value for our available budget.

I am migrating all the sites from cPanel shared hosting to CWP NPS hosting. The team is doing a good job in the migration, but there have been a few hiccups (there always are with software, right?) But the team is doing a good job addressing these things. There are a few points missing from the knowledge base articles that I need, but those will be resolved with tech support or customer service.

Support is great: fast and adequate. From a technical point of view the server was not. Still being a great installation to work with but on details it wasn't. DNSSEC not possible, SSL LAB score B, REDIS or Memcached not supported. In mapstructure subdomains are treated as domains. No automatic backups on server level, extra memory and storage are very expensive. Still a good choice if the basic configuration is good enough.

Review.Titre: In the 22+ years I have been in need of…
Review.Contenu: In the 22+ years I have been in need of web hosting only one of almost a dozen companies has delivered consistent uninterrupted and quality customer service. That web hosting company is InMotion Hosting.UPDATE: Technical assistance hours have been reduced on weekends with exception of online chat or messaging. Just now realizing this as I have a issue with my site not loading. Long wait for chat is not acceptable. I fixed it while waiting but not sure what it was I did. In defense of InMotion, they are not the only web hosting company that has cut back technical help to increase profits. Sadly customers are the ones affected.

Review.Titre: Good service and you weren’t bought out
Review.Contenu: Good service and you weren’t bought out by some giant corporation. Email on a shared host sucks though. Other people on the same server being allowed to spam gets my normal emails blocked all the time.
They provide consistent service, AWESOME support and are reasonably priced. We have had connectivity issues in the past but lately things have been rock solid.

Comprehensive platform that seems to require a body of experience to manage that many owners don't have. IT people likely have seen platforms like yours, but not us average folk with the basics.  Since we don't go in often, we forget a path needed to address something. Lots of ICONS to select from, but I don't always know what the ICON term represents.  If you had a sentence when you hover that describes what you can accomplish, or what its designed to do, it would be helpful.  Use lay to tech language so people don't become so frustrated and tie up your help line.

In the bigger picture, I've been very pleased with the service. However, due to some very nearly criminal behavior on Network Solution's part, I have been trying to transfer my domain name here, but it's been very confusing and slow going. Your people are doing their best on this process, I'm just a bit discouraged at the time it's taking.

Review.Titre: Support does their best to work with you
Review.Contenu: Support does their best to work with the tools provided by inMotion. The one issue I have is that CSF firewall does not play well with AlmaLinux. I have had to uninstall and reinstall 5 times. Had to call to get my server back up because of CSF.

Overall pretty good.  I got bounced around a few times trying to get questions answered at first, but once I got in touch with the right person, the rest of the process was pretty straightforwards.  Inmotion migrated my site quickly with no issues.

Customer support has been good.  I've found the split between AMP login, cPanel login, and webmail login, a bit confusing.  And the passwords, I think I've finally straightened out.  Trying to login and not being careful about "is it AMP" or is it "cPanel" has resulted in multiple reset passwords.
They provide great customer service. But they changed the call-in hours to be limited during weekdays/evenings only. I wish they would go back to 24/7. Otherwise, things are great!

Review.Titre: Turned out the first call didn’t…
Review.Contenu: Turned out the first call didn’t mention that when I closed the website the email would also closeI didn’t realise that, maybe I should have… but anyway the next call to you it was easily fixedSo all good

Overall experience for a number of years has been very good.  The only downside for me is that I am self-employed individual, and the technical side can be a bit intimidating.  I am not computer/internet literate!
Good website. They are really helpful when I have technical problems. We have used this company for a long time.

Review.Titre: Four days for tech support response.
Review.Contenu: The issue was resolved and the support rep was cordial but it took FOUR days to get a response.  This is way too long.

I used InMotion Hosting for more than a year now and had no problems with it at all. I give it 4 starts out of 5 because I feel like the design of the user interface can be a little bit better and more modern, however, from the technical point of view, it's still fine and everything work as it supposed to.
Prompt response, answered how to do what I wanted (reset wp-admin password). Didn't answer specific question: "why do I not get the email to reset my password".
Took a few phone calls, but eventually it all got resolved!  Everyone was helpful and pleasant!

Review.Titre: Good products, not transparent enough fees
Review.Contenu: The products offered by InMotion are good, the platform is intuitive enough for a non-programmer, and the prices are reasonable. However the fees are not transparent enough, and the payment platform says it accepts Paypal, but in reality payments can only be made directly by card.

Review.Titre: I have been dealing with hosting…
Review.Contenu: I have been dealing with hosting companies since 1997. Frankly put I have NEVER had a better experience with tech support. They are truly open 24/7 and all American born. They know their jobs and what to do. I have even called and all I could do was mumble, and they knew what I was talking about. As far as cost goes they are among the lowest price in the industry. Their speed on their servers is extremely fast, and that helps when th getting into Google. If you want the best, Inmotion Hosting is your best option.

Review.Titre: The customer service is excellent, However.
Review.Contenu: The customer service is excellent, however, the normal night shift support team is way more knowledgeable and more experienced than the dedicated hosting technical support team while one would expect the opposite.Also the dedicated hosting team doesn't have enough training on the new CWP system and that caused me some problems with my clients when I upgraded to CWP.The management shouldn't introduce new systems to client before training the staff sufficiently.The best team member I dealt with was Roger from the night shift team, he was very helpful and quick to find solutions.

Review.Titre: I love your tec support but too expensive after the first year
Review.Contenu: I love your tec support and the CS is pretty good. If only you could find a way to match the introductory rates to keep us long time customers. I have to find a new host just because I can't afford the "normal" rates!

Review.Titre: Made quick work of getting me my SSL…
Review.Contenu: Made quick work of getting me my SSL certificate and installing it.Hosting response to my question of PCI compliance took 4 emails and never did answer my question.

Review.Titre: I’m happy with the experience I’ve had…
Review.Contenu: I’m happy with the experience I’ve had with InMotion so far. They’re fairly easy to reach when you need support, and the support staff is friendly and helpful.
I'm happy with InMotion service, but do consider it on the expensive side.
You provide free SSL, not hidden charges, quick responding on help whenever required.
Just having a good hosting experience and quick support when in need. Thank you!

Review.Titre: Great Service and Staff, albeit slow loading times.
Review.Contenu: In my honest opinion inmotionhosting is one of the best paid web hosting provider companies with services of the best value. Their support is awesome and on point, and I would highly recommend this hosting provider to other users. The only issue that I've had with Inmotionhosting was very slow load time for both the account login (AMP PORTAL) and cPanel interface even on their most powerful shared hosting plans (greater then 5 seconds, no matter what internet connection/device used), which leads me to wonder how much resources are really being provided to you. Also, the difficult reCaptcha is an extremely large hinderance when logging in to AMP, adding additional time before I'm able to access my account. Other then that, it's a great first hosting provider that I do recommend for others to try.

Review.Titre: My ssl certificate doesn't seem to be…
Review.Contenu: Customer service was able to fix my ssl certificate problem on the online chat. Super simple process, thank you
The process to transition our hosting to InMotion was very simple and the pricing is perfect for our small non-profit association.
InMotion Hosting is consistent. We've had this host for several years now and we are pleased that it continues to offer great service and support.

Review.Titre: Flawless service and adjusting to user…
Review.Contenu: Flawless service and adjusting to user needs is a great plus, but annoying spam and fraud mail, and odd false bad address notifications still show how complicated the job is.
The support team was good which solved issues related to new server
It was easy enough to use to register the name. I wish verification and "next steps" how to setup link was given.

Review.Titre: Your customer support is great it…
Review.Contenu: Your customer support is great it really takes care of customers I really appreciate this thing but please try to answer more quicker as your customer support takes almost a day to answer queries thankyou.

Review.Contenu: InMotion should consider incorporating CDN and website Sécurity (liké Sacuri) in thé whole hosting packagé. Getting the same, especially CDN, from third parties is tedious and affects mail delivery.
